fields.description:
I've organized my local repositories into folders in SourceTree. If I want to re-order the local repositories inside a folder by dragging and dropping a selected item onto another position inside the folder, then this item is placed outside the folder afterwards.

My original view looks like this:
 * Folder A
 ** Repo A1
 ** Repo A2
 ** Repo A3  <- This one I want to move up before A2
 * Folder B

After I've dragged A3 and dropped it to its new position the view looks like this:
 * Folder A
 ** Repo A1
 ** Repo A2
 * Folder B
 * Repo A3  <- A3 is placed outside folder A now
fields.summary: Drag/drop of local repositories does not work correctly

fields.description:
Hi, after the latest release i started to see this issue a lot!, once it happens no matter how many times I restart the SourceTree, it'll keep happening.

Description of the problem:

the commit screen has staged and un staged sections, and the code changes on the right side section, when you do any action, it's not reloading the UI, for example if you stage a file, it will not throw any exception but UI won't refresh and you will see the file still in the un-staged section, then when you restart the SourceTree you would see the file moved to staging section normally,

 

Current behavior: UI is not refreshing by any action on the Commit screen (staging, unstaging, discarding, etc..)

 

Expected behavior: UI should always refresh to reflect the changes on the tool UI, as it was always do.
fields.summary: SourceTree: Commit screen is not refreshing as it was always do!

fields.description:
*Steps:*
1. Go to any Bitbucket repository in browser [https://bitbucket.org/]
2. Navigate to "Branches"
3. Select any branch
4. Click "Checkout" => "Checkout in sourcetree"
5. Click "Open sourcetree" in browser popup.
6. Click "Checkout" in Sourcetree "URL actions" popup

*Actual Result:*
Application is crashed.

*Expected Result:*
Selected branch is checked out and is active.
fields.summary: Crash on checking out branch from browser

fields.description:
With the latest Windows build 3.3.9 the integration with my local Bitbucket Server account is not persisted in the repositories and e.g. checking out branches via Bitbucket Server always causes problems because the optional extended integration options for a repository are not saved.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change respository extended settings from a the Standard to Bitbucket Server
2. Save changes and close Sourcetree
3. Open Sourcetree again and verify the extended settings are stored
fields.summary: Repository settings in optional extended integration with e.g. Bitbucket Server are not persisted

fields.description:
After upgrading to v3.3.6, I found out that in order to see changes in any file, I have to refresh the sourcetree with F5. Even if I stage the changes or checkout to new branch, the changes are reflected only after refresh.

P.S. The version I am using (v3.3.6) is not mentioned in list. So, I am using 3.3b1 in dropdown below.

!image-2020-01-13-13-28-39-539.png!
fields.summary: Source v3.3.6 Refresh Issue

fields.description:
In our company we use our Bitbucket server. So when we want to see repository on the web we have to enter to browser URL [https://url_of_bitbucket_server/projects/[project_name]/repos/[repo_name]]

But when I go to repo settings, choose edit on remote repository, set "Host Type" to Bitbucket server and Host Root URL to [https://url_of_bitbucket_server/|https://url_of_bitbucket_server/projects/[project_name]/repos/[repo_name]], then click on "Remote" button, It opens URL [https://url_of_bitbucket_server/[project_name]/[repo_name].|https://url_of_bitbucket_server/rob/rac.] This URL is not valid. I like the feature, but it not works with Bitbucket server. I cant find any other ways to fix the behavior
fields.summary: Open remote - URL customization

fields.description:
Open Repository Settings, Page "Remotes", select the default remote, click "Edit" -> crash

 

Can be reproduced every time. My repository is hosted on GitHub and was cloned using the Repository list inside SourceTree (I linked my GitHub account). Deleting and re-adding the same remote didn't change the problem.

 

The event log entry:

fields.description:
After adding GitHub account, my GitHub repositories are not showing in the list. Bitbucket  repositories show OK.

!image-2020-10-10-12-33-53-370.png!

!image-2020-10-10-12-34-32-201.png!

After adding GitHub account, my GitHub repositories are not showing in the list. Bitbucket  repositories show OK.

!image-2020-10-10-12-33-53-370.png!

!image-2020-10-10-12-34-32-201.png!

The tab name for the cloned repository overruns the close, 'x', button.

fields.description:
I have noticed this few times. This is happening mostly on multi monitor environment and when moving the Source Tree window from one to other window. 



How ever, the right mouse click options works (from clicking right mouse on the ST icon in the task bar).. and then selecting close ST.
fields.summary: Source tree Version 3.3.6 on Windows 10 Professional hangs

fields.description:
Presently, the combo box option that allow to choose between Tree View, Flat List (single) and Flat List (multiple) is shared between the File Status view and the History view.

Please separate them so that we can, for example, display files as a tree view in the History, while displaying files in File Status as a flat list, without having to switch the display option each time we switch the view we go in if we want to have a different display option in each view !
fields.summary: Keep Tree View / Flat List option separated for File Status and History

fields.description:
A lot of git commands, for example creating a new feature with git flow, give me the error that index.lock already exists. When I check with windows explorer and/or commandline, I don't see the file present in my .git folder though.

I found that when I close al my Visual Studio's, the problem is gone.

I believe the Visual Studio teams tab which has some sort of git integration conflicts with Sourcetree.

My Sourcetree is at version 3.3.9 and Visual Studio 2019 professional at 16.7.5.
fields.summary: index.lock error when Visual Studio is opened

fields.description:
Hi, I can't find any category for reporting documentation bugs in the Git tutorial at [https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/syncing,] so I'll place this issue in the SourceTree category.

The tutorial page contains statements like:

"Rename a remote connection from to ."

where the "from" and "to" names are missing.  This happens throughout the page.
fields.summary: Git tutorial bug

fields.description:
Currently the Refresh OAuth Token button in the Edit Hosting Account dialog automatically opens the browser.

This is a neat feature which is smooth in most cases, but there are times where the default browser is logged into a provider with a different account.
i.e.  User is authenticated in Edge for one contract and Chrome for another contract account.

It would be great to allow that user to copy and paste the generated URL to the browser of their choice to complete the OAuth transaction.

Obviously, please keep the button for the 90% use case of a single login with the default browser.
fields.summary: Allow copy and paste of URL generated by Refresh OAuth Token

fields.description:
Sourcetree keeps asking for a username and password for bitbucket.org for no reason.

Every few minutes, a popup appears asking for my credentials.
 * I use SSH for all my open repositories (I probably still have some using HTTPS, but none of them are open).
 * I don't even have any bitbucket.org repositories open
 * Under "Authentication" in the settings, I have no accounts
 * When I select New tab > Remote, there are no accounts.

I cannot find any other reason why it should think it should be trying to login to Bitbucket.

I have marked this as major because it happens every few minutes, which is absolutely infuriating.

I also cannot select the right version. I have 3.3.9 for Windows, which is what I downloaded from the website. But it says that doesn't exist. I have selected the closest version
fields.summary: Sourcetree keeps asking for password for bitbucket.org

fields.description:
I received a new PC and has to reinstall most of my applications. For some reason I am unable to check out. I followed the troubleshooting steps related to the app password section but no success. 

I require assistance ASAP as I am unable to deploy my dev and config in the UAT environment.

Thank you
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes every time I try to do a Checkout from Bitbucket

fields.description:
I'm use sourcetree for a while, once day it have update then after that while i open Sourcetree it will automatic suspend. I try to uninstall (from control panel & clear data from AppData) , and install again, But it not help. It auto suspend again. What should i do ? 

P.S. I'm use Windows (64-Bit) & I download sourcetree lastest version for windows 

[Videos|[https://youtu.be/TyqHL1sBqg8]]
fields.summary: Sourcetree auto suspend on Windows 10

fields.description:
Whatever if I make changes or not in Options dialog, Sourcetree crashes when closing it.

I can see some events in Windows Log Events, but nothing that can help me to resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Crash when closing Options dialog

fields.description:
STR:

1) Open new tab

2) Search for some repository (make sure list of shown repositories is filtered and first item is changed)

3) Press "Delete" button OR right click and select "delete".

 

Expected result:

Highlighted / "right-clicked" items is offered to be deleted.

 

Actual Result:

Result is inconsistent. Initially Modal dialog offered me to confirm deletion of my first item in the list, which in my case was a folder and at that point was hidden due to filtering.

Later I saw it was offering me to delete more than one repository.

Sometimes it worked as expected.

 

Note: My about dialog shows version 3.3.4, but Jira doesn't allow to select it so I put 3.3.9
fields.summary: Wrong items is suggested for deletion

fields.description: Unable to resolve conflicts using source tree v3.3.9
fields.summary: Unable to resolve conflicts using source tree v3.3.9

fields.description:
I'm using version 3.3.9 for Windows. The following reproduction steps lead to the issue.
 * Create a new Git repository.
 * Create two new files with many lines of text (large vertical width, enough to provoke a scroll bar in Sourctree).
 * Select both files in Sourcetree under "Unstaged files".
 * In the contents pane scroll to the bottom using the mouse scroll wheel.
 * Sourcetree will stop responding and must be closed from the task bar.
fields.summary: Scrolling to bottom of file content pane freezes program

fields.description:
Unable to open Kdiff3 external tool to resolve conflicts.

Details of software installed in system:

Source Tree version: 3.3.9

  !image-2020-09-14-15-53-49-996.png!
fields.summary: Unable to open Kdiff3 external tool to resolve conflicts

fields.description:
The commit time is not displayed in 24h, whereas my Windows time is set to 24h format (french settings).

The time is currently displayed in 12h format without any AM and PM indication, this is really annoying.
fields.summary: commit time in 24h format

fields.description:
I have a screen with max 730 pixels height. When I open Sourcetree / Actions / Create patch, the product opens a form in a modal window with a bigger height that my screen has and it is not scrollable. Therefore I am unable to use the application on that display.

I use the latest Windows version 3.3.8 but I cannot find it in the AffectsVersion field.
fields.summary: Modal window for Create Patch not usable on smaller screens

fields.description:
Steps:

1.Open sourcetree win 10

2. introduce ssh key

3. no repo opened, so the page with local repository will be showed

4. open  a local repository( no internet connection is need, no server need to be reached)

 

Expected: Everytime after step 4 sourcetree will load the repo

Actual: At step 4), some times the sourcetree becomes unresponsive and crash after 1.5- 2 seconds.
fields.summary: 3.3.9.3870 version crash sometime when trying to open a Repository  from local repositories

fields.description: Sometimes, when I was scrolling the stages panel, the application blocks and then I need to restart it.
fields.summary: Scrolling block

fields.description:
This started happening once I had updated to the latest version of Sourcetree 3.3.9.3870.

Windows 10 Home, version 10.0.18363, 64-bit.

!image-2020-09-11-13-39-43-161.png!
fields.summary: Push popup has no branches listed and does not allow to proceed

fields.description:
Line in diff clipped at the end.

Despite fully scrolling right, over 20 characters aren't displayed in the diff view. Have seen this situation multiple times. Reproductible with a chunk causing the issue but not all chunks with long lines cause this issue.

See attached screenshot for blurred details.

Current sourcetree version: 3.3.7, indicated as affecting latest released version (3.2.2).
Situation seen in: File Status -> Staged or Unstaged files. Note: staging or unstaging a chunk doesn't correct the issue.

Screenshot:
!image-2020-09-10-11-30-25-729.png!
fields.summary: Line not fully visible in diff

fields.description:
My SourceTree hangs whenever I tried to preview changes on different many files. The content is not very long but after clicking here and there it hangs/freezes. No 'Not Responding' at the taskbar. Just unclickable. I'm using Windows 10 

I have no issue with my home laptop using Mac.
fields.summary: SourceTree 3.3.9 Windows Hangs

fields.description: When reviewing and staging files prior to committing and pushing, I like to go through each one to ensure I didn't leave any TODOs or missing items. This goes a lot smoother if I could click "Stage Selected", have it stage that file then select the top one in the Unstaged files to review, so for lots of minor changes reviewing all of the files is faster.
fields.summary: Select Next Unstaged File when clicking "Stage Selected"

fields.description:
I have one monitor that runs at 144Hz, and one that runs at 60Hz. When I open sourcetree on the 60Hz monitor it works correctly, however on the 144Hz monitor it causes both monitors to turn on and off repeatedly (I'm guessing the graphics card is resetting over and over again). To fix I must turn off the 144Hz monitor, move sourcetree on to the 60Hz monitor and then turn the 144Hz monitor on again.

I believe this is a recent regression, as I use sourcetree everyday and didn't notice this behavior before.

 

I am using sourcetree 3.3.7, however that doesn't appear in the dropdown when creating this ticket.
fields.summary: Big problems with high refresh rate monitors

fields.description: I have just set up Sourcetree on a new computer, and started cloning my remote repository. I did one part by hand, to confirm that the access keys, passwords etc. are all in place. When I click on the "Remote" tab, or "remote account" on the "Clone" tab, Sourcetree closes without any error message.
fields.summary: Accessing Remote Account closes Sourcetree

fields.description:
h5. Step 1: Go to Settings

Step 2: Navigate to the Advanced Window and Uncheck "Use global user settings" as well as remove "AD/" from the start of your name.

Step 3:  Click OK.
h5. Step 4: Go to Settings.

Step 5: Navigate to the Advanced Window

Actual results:  Changes to settings are lost.

Expected results:  Changes remain.
fields.summary: Setting lost in repository settings dialog.

fields.description:
When creating a new repository I find all me files as unstaged and I need to add them from the Unstaged pane.

It would be helpful to have the files displayed as in windows file explorer with all the columns in order to sort them by extension or name.

At the moment I can only sort them by path and filename.
fields.summary: Display file details in the Unstaged pane

fields.description:
Push changes immediately to field frequently becomes "-" and is not clear hot wo make it point to correct location.

!image-2020-09-01-08-11-44-155.png!
fields.summary: Push Changes immediately to field frequently becomes "-"

fields.description:
h4. Environment
 * Windows 7 Professional 64-bit
 ** Outdated, I know
 * Sourcetree v3.3.8.3848

h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Commit a text file
 # Write a huge amount of lines (e.g. 20,000 lines) to the file
 # Add and commit the change
 # Show "History" page

h4. Current Behavior
 * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, and a user can't do anything but just wait for a long time or terminate this app because it never releases the whole control before finishing everything

h4. Appreciated Behavior

Any one (or more) of these:
 * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a timeout occurs because it took too long time to load
 ** It would be great if the timeout length can be modified in preferences.
 * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a user can interrupt it anytime by pressing Esc key or a kind of "Cancel" button
 * Sourcetree tries to display the huge diff fully, but a user can interrupt it anytime by clicking on another file or commit with light changes because loading is processed only in the diff pane at the lower right
 * Sourcetree displays diffs partly only within the scrolled area of the diff pane
 * Sourcetree doesn't start to display diffs automatically before selecting a file in commits
 ** It's just like the diff pane of the "File Status" page says "Select a file to view the diff" when no files are selected.
 * Sourcetree doesn't start to display the huge diff automatically because this app knows its hugeness before the loading
 ** It's just like GitHab says "Large diffs are not rendered by default" when showing commit detail page.
 * Or another cool solution...
fields.summary: Huge diff loading shouldn't lock Sourcetree

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:* 
 # Open app Proizd
 # Select the field "Calendar"
 # Scroll the page up continuously
 # Scroll the page down continuously

*Expected results:* 
 * Calendar is on the screen in both cases

*Actual results*
 * Calendar disappears from the screen

*Environment:* 
 * IPhone XR
 * ios 13.6.1
fields.summary: Calendar disappears while scrolling the page up or down continuously

fields.description:
Suggestion : ability to hide (or disable) the diff pane (or its real time update) in File Status view.

Reason : when multi selecting files (in order to stage, discard or whatever action we want to apply), each selection change updates the diff pane content. When those files of big or binary, that update made by the diff can easily freeze SourceTree for multiple seconds, and the bigger you extend your selection, the worse it is.

I've been in cases where I had to fight for more than a minute to get a selection of less than 10 files.

While it is really unlikely that we want to show multiple files diffs at once in the same view (for ergonomic/readability reason), it is really common to select multiple file to take actions on them. This diff update freeze makes it really painful to apply actions on multiple files in your software.
fields.summary: Ability to hide diff pane in File Status view

fields.description:
The source binaries provided for subjected application *“SourceTreeSetup-3.3.8.exe”* trying to connect to internet to install the software. We are looking at an offline installer(Installer which doesn’t need internet connectivity to install) of source tree.

Can you please let us know if we can get an offline installer for Sourcetree which is packaged readily to install.
fields.summary: We need an offline Installer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Local branches not matching the remote branch being tracked are ignored by Push.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
If I have local branches which don't match the name of the remote branch being tracked, the "push" dialog on SourceTree completely ignores those branches. Repeatable behaviour. Those branches push fine with SmartGit.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to push local branches here.

h3. Actual Results
I have a branch which is a tracking branch, but a diffrent name to the tracking branch. ST doesn't display it AT ALL for pushing, but knows it needs to be pushed.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Push ignores local branches that don't match a remote tracking branch

fields.description:
This happens now that I was prompted to upgrade to version 3.3.9, which is in the list below as unreleased, but is the version that the software told me to use and the version that downloads from the main website.

My remote repository is not available. I know this and need to be able to add another remote repository. When I go to the Remote tab the entire program crashes and closes.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when remote repository is not available

fields.description:
Popup confirmation window appears out of main window bounds and is unable to drag.

It seems, that popup position is calculated according to the biggest screen height (I have a 2 monitor setup, where one of them is rotated vertically) 

The screenshot displays the position of the popup window: http://prntscr.com/u5hjba
fields.summary: Popup window position

fields.description: Sometimes Sourcetree deletes file or few files, when I do stage. I can't figure out circumstances related to this behavior. It seems to be happening accidentally (only sometimes).  It can delete one or few files from 10 that are in a state changed. After stage these files are in a sub-window "Staged file" in state deleted.
fields.summary: Sourcetree deletes file if I do stage

fields.description:
After updating to 3.3.9 (Windows), there are several popups appear then quickly disappear consecutively every some amount of time, maybe an hour. It is extremely annoying. I have tried removing all Atlassian folders in AppData and reinstalled SourceTree but the problem persists. There seems to be nothing interesting in the logs. The only fix is to close SourceTree.

There is another person reporting the same problem [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Sourcetree-launch-popup-flashes-for-sometime-then-nothing/qaq-p/1461203?tempId=eyJvaWRjX2NvbnNlbnRfbGFuZ3VhZ2VfdmVyc2lvbiI6IjIuMCIsIm9pZGNfY29uc2VudF9ncmFudGVkX2F0IjoxNTk3OTI3NTYyMDI2fQ%3D%3D]
fields.summary: Popups flashes periodically with no contents

fields.description: If you provide a option to launch external diff tool instead of launching editor on double click in Unstage Files and Staged Files views that would be superb.
fields.summary: Launch external diff tool on double click

fields.description:
There was a vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS and windows that could reveal Git user credentials via maliciously crafted URL by an attacker, This vulnerability is triggered when the affected version of Git is used to execute a git clone command on a malicious URL.

Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree For Mac allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.

Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree for Windows allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.

*Affected versions:*
 * Windows version 3.2.2 and earlier

*Fixed versions:*
 * Windows version 3.3.9

*Released Sourcetree for Windows version 3.3.9* that contains fixes for these issues and can be downloaded from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/].

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SOURCETREEKB&title=SourceTree+Security+Advisory+2020-09-02]
fields.summary: Git submodules vulnerability in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2020-5260

fields.description:
hello and thank you for this software,

Can you add the possibility in "Tools > options" to change the font size of the text in windows (History window, commit...)?

I'm old ;)

Best regards
fields.summary: User interface font size.

fields.description:
A silly behaviour I have noticed, for some years now.
 * Create a new branch in Visual Studio. Create some commits.
 * Try to push the branch to GitHub in SourceTree by using the 'Push' button.
 * Check the new branch in the popup. The local name is copied as remote name.
 * Press 'Push' in the popup. An error is displayed: "The Remote branch '' (Local branch = 'MyName') is invalid. Ref names must follow git ref-format rules:
 [https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-check-ref-format.html]
 Completed with errors, see above."
 * Now CUT the remote name, and PASTE IT BACK. Now pushing works! I don't know why, I don't see spaces or anything.

A silly little trick to get it working. But I must have been banging my head before I ever found it!
fields.summary: Pushing a new branch gives a false eror messag about git ref-format rules

fields.description:
Hello, 

I am unable to clone a remote repository. I have tried the suggested clearing the files userhost and passwd, deleting accounts saved in authentification and restarting sourcetree. I have been dealing with this issue for some days now.

I attach the message it shows:

Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks ls-remote [https://sourcecode.jnj.com/scm/itx-acm/delphi.git]
Output:
Error: fatal: remote error: CAPTCHA required
Your Bitbucket account has been locked. To unlock it and log in again you must
solve a CAPTCHA. This is typically caused by too many attempts to login with an
incorrect password. The account lock prevents your SCM client from accessing
Bitbucket and its mirrors until it is solved, even if you enter your password
correctly.

If you are currently logged in to Bitbucket via a browser you may need to
logout and then log back in in order to solve the CAPTCHA.

Visit Bitbucket at [https://sourcecode.jnj.com|https://sourcecode.jnj.com/] for more details.
fields.summary: Unable to clone remote repository

fields.description: Hi I'm currently experiencing issue with opening SourceTree on Windows. I have it installed and while I'm opening it, it gets instantly closed without any issue notification popping up. I have tried some self-troubleshooting but no luck so far. I have tried to remove the AppData/Source folders and re-installed but it didnt allow me set up the config again. Not sure how to proceed. Thanks!
fields.summary: Cannot Launch Sourcetree

fields.description:
When I open git project in SourceTree and the path has Cyrillic letters in it, when I click on the _Rebase children of <commit> interactively_ in the history of commits:

!image-2020-08-06-16-18-47-597.png!

It opens the interactive rebase window but it's empty: !image-2020-08-06-16-19-42-714.png!

If I then put my git project in the place, which doesn't have any Cyrillic letters in the path, it opens the interactive rebase window with all the commits as it's supposed to:

!image-2020-08-06-16-21-35-110.png!

Here's a video demonstration of the bug: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Df-hfD6gK0A]

As you can see in the video, when the path is _H:\Books\Programming\C#\Читаемые\Mastering WPF_, it doesn't show any commits in the list when I click on the _Rebase children of <commit> interactively..._ menu. After I copy the git project to the ___H:\Books\Programming\C#\Mastering WPF_ path and then click on the _Rebase children of <commit> interactively..._ menu, commits show up in the list as they're supposed to.
fields.summary: Rebase children of <commit> interactively... doesn't work(Cyrillic letters in the path)

fields.description: Now sourcetree for windows only has a setup exe, can you provide a portable version(.zip format) so that I can unzip it to a USB stick and use it on any computer without install it first.
fields.summary: Release a portable Sourcetree for windows

fields.description:
*Описание:*

+Шаги:+

1. Открыть приложение "Украинская железная дорога"

2. Выбрать меню "Кабинет пользователя"

3. Ввести любой валидный email в поле "Email"

4. Ввести любой валидный пароль в поле "Пароль"

5. Нажать кнопку "Войти с Facebook"

+Ожидаемый результат:+

1. Пользователь автоматически авторизуется по  указанным данным с Facebook для последующей покупки билетов

Фактический результат:

1. При нажатии кнопки "Войти с Facebook" программа выдается ошибку "Login Failed: You can't use Facebook to log into this app or website because there's an issue with its implementation of Facebook Login"
fields.summary: Баг в приложении "Украинская железная дорога"
Authorization in the user's account is not possible through the social network "facebook"

fields.description:
I have a project checked out in source tree, I have three local branches (2 from origin, 1 from secondary remote) from 2 different remotes.

When I go to push to the secondary remote (the one added after the checkout of the first remote), I cannot push the local branch from the secondary remote to the second (their) origin. Only the local branch(s) from the first remote are available. This caused me to inadvertently push my origins local branch to a secondary remote because I didn't notice it was missing and was confused knowing I needed to push to their master. 

 

See screenshot for an example:

!image-2020-07-31-10-20-49-675.png!
fields.summary: Remote local branch is not shown in push menu when more than 2 remotes

fields.description:
Hi Team

I am trying to register my sourcetree, but it fails with "oops, you have found a dead link" : This happens whether i try from sourcetree itself or if I try via web ([https://my.atlassian.com/license/sourcetree|https://id.atlassian.com/signup?application=mac&continue=https://my.atlassian.com/license/sourcetree]). 

My Atlassian id is [satishkumar.ramachandran@sc.com.|mailto:satishkumar.ramachandran@sc.com.]

 

Please help to fix.
fields.summary: Sourcetree registration fails

fields.description:
When browsing for remote repositories, SourceTree nicely shows the list of all available Github repositories for my account. When I enter text in the Search box however (text that I know should give me a match), the list goes empty and a red cross icon overlay appears on my Github account. As soon as I clear the search box, the icon overlay dissappears and I get the full list of repos again. Since we have a large amount of repos the search is quite important.

Note: my SourceTree Windows version is actually 3.3.8, but Jira doesn't allow me to select that version.

*Reproduction*
 * Open a new tab
 * Click on the Remote button
 * Select the appropriate Github account from the list of remote accounts
 * Watch the list of Github repos populate
 * Enter text in the Search box that should return a match

*Expected result*
 * The list of repositories is filtered by the entered text

*Actual result*
 * The list of repos turns empty
 * A red cross icon overlay appears on top of the Github account gravatar
 * A hover over of the red cross shows mentioning ... validation failed ... (see image)

!image-2020-07-28-16-43-56-370.png!
fields.summary: Remote Github repository search does not work

fields.description:
Hello, 

when I exectue push then everything looks fine and no error dialog is shown. After the push button is confirmed and dialog is closed then there are still unpushed commits. 

Please, can anyone help me solve this problem?
fields.summary: Can't push

Hello,

when I switch to remote tab (remote repositories) then Sourcetree suddenly crashes. There are two log entries that occures when the crash happens. The entries are: 

ERROR [2020-07-28 07:33:45,605] [1] [SourceTree.Model.Repository] [Log] - Repository: [] does not exist
ERROR [2020-07-28 07:33:56,343] [1] [SourceTree.Exceptions.RemoteHostException] [Log] - Failed to list teams for user [olafvolafka]

Does anyone have the same problem? Or does anyone have solution to this?

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:   1.  Open site: https://cek.dp.ua/

                                    2.  Press F12 

                                    3. Click on tab 'Source" in the open window

                                    4.  Click on the tab in the left block "Page"

                                    5. Follow link:  top>cek.dp.ua>images>slider>[zvernennia.jpg|https://cek.dp.ua/images/slider/zvernennia.jpg]

*Expected result*:  Site loading will be less than 5 seconds

*Actual result*:   When you enter the main page - the site is loaded for more than 20 seconds

*Notes*:  1. Image can be compressed on: [https://compressjpeg.com/]
fields.summary: Site performance is very low because image are large

fields.description:
*Preconditions*: Thise site was made on knees at the university - prepare ur eyes to be ready for what u see =D

*Steps to reproduce*: 1.  Open site: https://cek.dp.ua/

                                    2.  Press CRTL + U

*Expected result*: Site loading will be less than 5 seconds

*Actual resul*t: When you enter the main page - the site is loaded for more than 20 seconds

*Notes*: 1. Move all scripts to the site footer or reduce their number

             2. Update Joomla!  to the latest version 3.9.20 on 2020.07.25
fields.summary: Site performance is very low because scripts are in the head of the site

fields.description:
A long time ago I observe that during a long idle ssh-agent process loads 100% of one of the cores of my 4-core Intel core i7 on Windows 10. Reinstall OS do not solve this problem. Every time if i leave my laptop running with Source Tree at night, then in the morning I get guaranteed this situation.
 Currently I use 3.3.8 version, but the bug independent from this.

!image-2020-07-25-08-51-30-138.png!
fields.summary: ssh agent overloading cpu

fields.description:
Heyho,

I set up a shared submodule, and whenever I stage a file in Sourcetree it shows that all files contents are deleted, so effectively Sourcetree states that I am staging a deleted file. When I unstage, the file is deleted. When I add the file via the terminal, it all works flawlessly. I think the tricky thing here is the shared submodule part, with which Sourcetree has trouble. While it could be that I am doing something wrong, I have the belief that Sourcetree is doing more than a simple 'git add' (as that works from the command line).

I set up the shared submodule as followed:

1. Clone the project that should serve as the shared submodule locally to some directory
2. In the shared submodule, modify the local config of this project by adding 'worktree = ..' under [core]

For all projects sharing this submodule:

3. Add the submodule (this means, effectively I now have two checked out copies of that project)
4. Delete the respective submodule folder in ./git/submodule/
5. Delete the content of the submodule directory apart from the .git file
6. Modify the .git in the submodule directory to point to the path of the project setup in 1)

 

(reason for shared submodule is that we have the same code base across different projects, and this way I can change a file in the code base once and it is applied to all projects without having to pull their respective submodule first)
fields.summary: Staging in a shared submodule leads to deletion of files

fields.description: I am able to login in Stash link but opening same link in Source tree shows error "This is not valid source path/URL"
fields.summary: Unable to login Source Tree

fields.description:
Upon running Sourcetree installer I will get a cmd line popup with SquirrelUpdate, it stays blank, then I will get the blue Sourcetree panel popup for about 5 seconds. Then both will close and no further actions are taken by the pc. This happens even when attempting to install previous versions or enterprise version.

 

One thing of note, here is output of sourcetree.log

2020-07-16T14:34:32: CompositionException [Import "SourceTree.Security.DefaultSshKeyManager.Agents" could not be satisfied.]
ERROR [2020-07-16 14:34:44,210] [1] [Sourcetree.Composition.VSMef.Net471.CompositionExceptionHelper] [Log] - CompositionException [Import "SourceTree.Security.DefaultSshKeyManager.Agents" could not be satisfied.]
2020-07-16T14:35:03: CompositionException [Import "SourceTree.Security.DefaultSshKeyManager.Agents" could not be satisfied.]
ERROR [2020-07-16 14:35:15,840] [1] [Sourcetree.Composition.VSMef.Net471.CompositionExceptionHelper] [Log] - CompositionException [Import "SourceTree.Security.DefaultSshKeyManager.Agents" could not be satisfied.]
fields.summary: Sourcetree fails to install or open.

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks push -v --tags --set-upstream origin feature/featurename:feature/featurename
Pushing to https://devtechhbe.visualstudio.com/\{private-info}/_git/\{private-info}
 1 [main] sh 1216 dofork: child 1217 - died waiting for dll loading, errno 11
40001315 [sig] sh 1216 get_proc_lock: Couldn't acquire sync_proc_subproc for(5,1), last 6, Win32 error 0
40001517 [sig] sh 1216 proc_subproc: couldn't get proc lock. what 5, val 1
40001931 [main] sh 1216 cygwin_exception::open_stackdumpfile: Dumping stack trace to sh.exe.stackdump
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://devtechhbe.visualstudio.com/\{private-info}/_git/\{private-info}'
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Can't push branch to Azure Git

fields.description:
Attempting to run a Custom Action does nothing. They used to work perfectly, and neither the scripts or the settings of the custom actions have changed.

 

How to replicate:

Right click on a commit -> Custom Actions -> The action
fields.summary: Custom actions not working

fields.description:
Recently, I started getting the message that because my company uses Single Sign-on I needed to create an App Password to log in, I did, and then when I try to commit my changes in Source tree I still get the message.

I have Source tree version 3.3.4 (it doesn't show up on the drop down list below)
fields.summary: I cannot log in to my Repository in Source Tree after Creating App password

fields.description:
When I choose "Check out in Sourctree" button it always proposes to clone new repository. When I choose to checkout existing and point to cloned repository it complains about missing details (see image below). The repository was cloned few minutes ago using Sourcetree. When I choose "clone new" it will be successfully cloned with selected branch, but trying it again, this using "checkout existing" it will complain again (see image).

The only instance where I can choose an option to "Checkout Existing" is when I clone fresh repository and don't close Sourctree, but the checkout will fail and Sourctree will close without pulling new branch.

Pull/push/fetch and other operations from within Sourctree itself work flawlessly. I only have trouble when using "Check out in Sourctree" button in bitbucket.

!image-2020-07-14-14-26-23-935.png!
fields.summary: "Check out in Sourctree" always tries to clone new and complains about missing details.

fields.description: We use Sourcetree as out Git GUI and BitBucket as our Git hosting service. When I click on "Check out in Sourcetree" button, Sourcetree will show the appropriate dialog that allows to choose how to check out / clone. After this dialog is closed, no matter the result, Sourctree will close. It is either a terrible UI design, or a crash without any error message. (I suspect the latter hence
fields.summary: Sourctree closes after "Checkout in Sourctree" button was used in BitBucket.

fields.description:
Hello,

I am trying setting up sourcetree.

I had the code few years ago, and now I try to install the sourcetree again.

 

After running setup, source-tree is opened,

but I see three account on the left pane (don't know if it matters), and after few seconds the program is aborted.

 

Please, help.

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Problem when trying setup sourcetree

fields.description:
After restarting Sourcetree, It always goes back to the default "Generic Account/Generic Host" despite having previously selected my own github account and saved. This applies both to the Upstream and Origin settings.
 As you can see, the world icon (Remote) on the top right has a red mark, which goes away once you have selected your own github account as mentioned above, but it comes back after restarting.

[Screenshot|[https://pasteboard.co/JgYEp4G.png]]

Happens on 3.3.4.
fields.summary: Remote details in a github repository settings don't get saved

fields.description: Cannot install Sourcetree for Windows v.2.4.8.0 on Windows 8! When registering the product on the 3d step (Atlassian account) it opens the dead link - and can't proceed further. Newer versions won't work on Windows 8 at all.
fields.summary: Cannot install Sourcetree for Windows v.2.4.8.0 on Windows 8

fields.description:
Performing any operation on a Bitbucket repo using SourceTree causes errors.

Upon performing any action requiring a connection to the remote (pull, push, etc.) login prompts appear over and over and never stop.  I have an app password for Sourcetree and that doesn't work. My main Bitbucket password also doesn't work. Additionally I have an SSH key set up on both Bitbucket and the computer where I'm running SourceTree.

This is not the first time I've experienced this.  Getting SourceTree to properly authenticate with Bitbucket is like pulling teeth.  Before I remove this from my computer and replace it with something that actually works, I want to give this one last shot.

There's even a bug with the ticket reporting system. I'm running SourceTree 3.3.9 and it's telling me that version doesn't exist!
fields.summary: Authentication not working

fields.description:
When I go to the authentication tab in the _Options_ menu, I can only see blank entries:

!image-2020-07-05-13-54-55-726.png!



It worked properly so far.
fields.summary: Can't use authentication options

fields.description:
*Steps to produce:*

1. Go to Envato.com
2. Tab Browse all

*Expected result:*  Line is written as: Результаты для цифровых ресурсов

*Actual result:* Line is written as: Результаты для цифровые ресурсы
fields.summary: Galaxy S7 - Envato Elements (Music tracks section) - Wrong translation (russian language)

fields.description:
Hi,

I am trying to add a new repo locally, and as such I open a new tab in Sourcetree, click the Remote subtab, and click "Add an account...".

However, that opens a window named "Edit Hosting Account". The *Edit* doesn't really make sense, because I clicked Add button (it's confusing). In addition, under the Credentials section, with OAuth as default value in Authentication, then the Username field is read only.

Is this on purpose?

The workaround is to change the Authentication to Basic, then edit the Username field (as it becomes editable), then switch Authentication back to OAuth, and finally click Refresh OAuth Token button.

 

If possible, I will attach a screenshot to show the details.

I am using Sourcetree v. *3.3.9* on Windows 10, 64-bit, v1909.
fields.summary: Add an Account in Remote Tab Opens Edit Hosting Account Window with Username in Ready Only

fields.description:
When I start SourceTree for WInows (Version 3.3.8), the Remote button has a red expalmation mark next to it. When I click it, it says 

"Unable to open your web browser to ''git@bitbucket.org:my_repository", do you have a default web browser set?"

I then click "Cancel" on the pop-up, Settings on the far right, select my remote, click edit, I DON'T change anything, click OK, click OK and the exclamation mark disappears, I can open my remote repository in the web browser.  

All I do is "re"save the already existing information. There is nothing new. Why does that change anything?

Expected behavior: no opening and saving required, just open the remote in the web browser the first time. 

=================

By the way: why is version 3.3.8 missing in the "Affects Versions" field below? I just chose a random one ...
fields.summary: Unable to open Web Browser Message

fields.description: Github desktop has a nice feature that I miss in sourcetree.  it is the ability to update my branch from the remote master.  Currently in soucetree I need to switch to the master,  update the master, switch back to the branch and the merge my locally updated master into the branch.  This is quite painful for a workflow which needs to be done often.  This is a 1 click operation in Github desktop.
fields.summary: update branch from remote master (as in Github Desktop)

fields.description:
Hi,

 

To perform pull,commit or push an error is being thrown that unable to authenticate.
fields.summary: Unable to pull the new updates from the branch"failed to aunthenticate"

fields.description:
I'd like to reorder my bookmarks under Windows, but this does not appear to be possible. At the top level, bookmarks seem to be arranged alphabetically, and this cannot be changed. Inside a folder, bookmarks are listed in the order that they were added to the folder, and this cannot be changed. An attempt to drag a bookmark within a folder appears to be responsive, but either results in a bookmark not being moved, or the bookmarked being kicked outside of the folder, in which case the order has been messed up. This is extremely frustrating.

 

Actually using 3.3.4, but that does not appear in the versions popup? The highest version is 3.2.2.
fields.summary: Can't rearrange bookmarks

fields.description:
I don't know when it starts exactly but it would have been a couple of months that sourcetree doesn't update their file status view automatically.

I've suffered and waited until this small problem has gone, but it looks not.

So I'm here for if the devs even do not notice this problem is.

I hope I will not press my F5 key anymore every time I do something with sourcetree.

 

ps. my sourcetree version is currently 3.3.6 (which is the newest version) but it doesn't appear in the below version list. so I picked the highest version in the list.
fields.summary: File status not updated automatically anymore

fields.description: I using Windows and just learned how to use sourcetree. Despite it being a bit better than Github Desktop, the performance is still not good enough. I just played around with a unity project where a record was not inserted in a branch and I had to waste some time merging, discarding and restarting sourcetree. Now I come across yet another case of a record not inserted. This time it's much worse as discarding option is not available. Please do not place this on low priority by saying it's bad design, not a bug and therefore, you can safely ignore this. In the long-term, I already wasted time removing the record and I don't like how you work. You also designed this website so badly so I cannot insert a screenshot for you to see. Just make it compulsory for users to either insert in an existing branch OR force create an extra branch. I'm using the latest 3.2.8.
fields.summary: Bug / Bad design: Why are branches not created?

fields.description:
Hi,

We are experiencing failed authentications with remote Bitbucket repository through SourceTree.

Account addition was well authenticated but when pushing/pulling from remote to local repo, it returns an error about incorrect credentials.

Image A(Validation that account used was authenticated)

!image-2020-06-17-11-31-02-312.png!

 

Image B(commit not executed due to authentication issue)

!image-2020-06-17-11-32-35-455.png!
fields.summary: Failed Authentication after account setup

fields.description:
Someone forgot to put in a check to limit the number of failed login attempts.

When connecting, failed authentication repeats multiple times leading to account locked out.

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://URL/repo.git/'
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://URL/repo.git/'
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://URL/repo.git/'
fatal: Authentication failed for '[https://URL/repo.git/'
|https://url/repo.git/']fatal: remote error: CAPTCHA required
Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Multiple Failed Authentication causes lockout

fields.description: When I open Sourcetree, it happens to crash every now and then and when I try to open a repository it happens too...  I don't know why it keeps happening, I don't know where is the log report for those kinds of bug to be more specify. Now the crash happend every time when I try to open sourcetree. In the file SourceTree, in AppData/Local/SourceTree, the version of the file app is app-3.3.8.
fields.summary: Crashes happen every now and then

fields.description:
In my repository set up, I have Folders {{A}} and {{B}} in my SourceTree and each of those folders has a repo named {{X}} inside. The repos are located in different folders on the file system and they actually point to different remotes, but they have same names.

When I have double clicked on my side pane on repo {{X}} from folder {{A}}, it opens up as expected. When I double click on my side pane on repo {{X}} from folder {{B}}, however, nothing happens.

Expected results is that I have two tabs opened with those different repos having the same name.

 

This is definitely a regression, but it has been there for a while. It reproduces in 3.3.8 but also was there in 3.3.6

 

(I had to put {{3.2.2}} as a version in Affects Versions field because there is no {{3.3.8}} in the list, so please add it as well)
fields.summary: Repository is not opened if a tab with another repository having the same name already exists

fields.description:
Log / History correctly shows commit time correct for the time zone that local machine is in.

Commit description shows local time of commit with no timezone information.

e.g.

!image-2020-06-07-13-09-52-566.png!

PC local time is Australia/Brisbane i.e. UTC+10 set in Windows

Occurs in a freshly downloaded 3.3.8 also but there's no option to select it in the affect versions list.
fields.summary: Timezones not used to display local time in commit summary

fields.description:
Managing a number of developers working on multiple tasks, it is difficult to easily see what commits are being done to active branches.

If the History view would add a branch name column and populate that for each commit that would make it much easier to see what commits are being done to branches.   Also the history view needs to allow the user to click on the "branch name" column title to have it sort by branch name and by date (new->old) so they would be grouped together.  A second click on the column title toggles the sort direction(ascending / descending) for Branch Name.

Being able to sort by Author in the same way would be very helpful as well.
fields.summary: Add Branch name column to History view and allow view to sort by branch name

fields.description:
Open huge repo like

[https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project.git]
 * going to the "Search"
 * enter something like "[clangd]"
 * search panel does not filter anything ;

 

P.S.: version 3.3.8 used
fields.summary: Search does not work with huge repo

fields.description:
Force push may cause application crash for repository that have submodules.
Also window that ask confirmation for force push closes automatically in 1 second for repository that have submodules. It is very hard to click "Yes" in this 1 second.

Version: 3.3.8.3848
Git version: 2.26.2
OS: Windows 10
fields.summary: Force push crashes

fields.description: They simply do not show up in the Push / Pull dialog
fields.summary: SourceTree is not able to pull/push branches with / in the name, e.g. release/2020.05

fields.description:
Steps:

Preconditions: logged into Bitbucket using Atlassian account
 # Install the latest SourceTree 3.3.8 from [https://sourcetreeapp.com/]
 # !image-2020-06-02-18-16-29-990.png!
 # Created account by using OAuth
!image-2020-06-02-18-10-04-837.png!
 # clone particular repository from SourceTree or butbucket page
 # got login error several times
 # locked account
 # !image-2020-06-02-18-12-19-769.png!

NOTE: Uninstalling doesn't clean up the data, so I cannot perform clean install again.
fields.summary: SourceTree locks corporate Atlassian account when trying to clone repository from Bitbucket.

fields.description:
When using `Show Full Output` option which doesn't close output automatically, the focus is set wrongly.

In previous versions it was correct, which allowed pressing ENTER on the keyboard to close output dialog, but currently the focus is below ouput dialog, which causes weird things, e.g. pressing commit button instead of closing output window.

It is regression from previous versions, because it always worked correct.

It is happening on newest version 3.3.8 - I can't choose it properly from combo box below.
fields.summary: SourceTree wrong focus after seeing console output

fields.description: Hi, I cannot register to SourceTree using my corporate account [AnubhavKrishna.Tiwari@fmr.com.|mailto:AnubhavKrishna.Tiwari@fmr.com.]
fields.summary: Cannot register to SourceTree using my corporate account

fields.description:
Branch is not shown in Push window if renamed during checkout from remote. Steps to reproduce:
 # Double click or right click and checkout a remote branch (in origin).
 # In the popup window rename the branch.
 # Branch is created locally with the new name, but does not show up in the Push window, both through the toolbar Push button and through the Push option in the right click menu on the branch.

(Workaround:) Create another branch locally from this locally renamed branch by clicking Branch in the toolbar. This new branch can be pushed as expected.

This only happens when renaming the remote branch on checkout. If it is not renamed, it can be pushed as expected.

Tested in Sourcetree for Windows 3.3.8.

End.
fields.summary: Show remote branches renamed on checkout in push window.

fields.description:
h3. Use Case

In our project, due to the branching model, most of the merges are none `fast-forward` merges. Therefore, I have set `git config merge.ff false` in my config in case I am merging from the terminal. However, with this setting I am not capable any longer to "force" a `fast-forward` merge from Sourcetree! Even if I uncheck *Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible*, Sourcetree triggers a "normal" merge thus falling back onto the settings from the git config.
h3. Cause of the issue

Sourcetree calls {{git merge branch-name}} when *Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible* is not checked:

```
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks merge branch-name
```
h3. Suggestion

Be explicit with the command that is triggered by Sourcetree when unchecking. That is, ...

... either make `git merge --ff branch-name` the command which is triggered (instead of `git merge branch-name`),

... or even provide a option like *Require fast-forward merge* triggering `git merge --ff-only branch-name`.
fields.summary: Provide an option to force a "fast-forward" merge from within Sourcetree

fields.description: When i try to connect my github Account whit the source tree and i click ok, the source tree crash, and if try to open the source tree again, it's still crashing, Im using the last version released, 3.3.6
fields.summary: Source Tree Crash when add a new github account
